Title: Limited research
Description: Just a simple research. Web searching, AI asking and putting it all together in a dataset.

Title: Customer focus research
Description: Who is your main customer? Who will benefit from your service? How can you deliver a value?

Title: Technical focus research
Description: How to make what you wana make? What technologies would you use? How can they work together?

Title: Full scale research
Description: You throw all your resources and efforts to make your product the best fit possible. It will help in a long run... probably.

Title: Essential prototype
Description: This prototipe will just show that your idea works. It is ugly. It is buggy. But it proves the very basic concept.

Title: Service prototype
Description: This isn't a technical prototype. You have your landing page up and running, and you should do everything else by hand with every client.

Title: Technical prototype
Description: Now you know, that everything is working on the technical side. User experience? Never heard about this.

Title: Product MVP
Description: This MVP proves everything and you can ship it to selected audience. It is well designed. Well built. And it took time and effort to make it this early.

Title: Mission only
Description: Now your crew knows why are you doing what you are doing.

Title: Values and Strategy
Description: Values will help your team to make important decisions. Strategy will navigate them on which decisions they should make.

Title: Values and Mission
Description: Values will help your team to make important decisions. Mission will give them purpose to make these decisions.

Title: Values, Mission and Strategy
Description: You have done it all. Now your team knows why, how, and which decisions they should make. It invokes confidence.

Title: Internal testing
Description: Your team and friends are enough to test your product. There is no need to gather the audience.

Title: Medium focus group testing
Description: Your testing group consists of a few dozens of people both from your audience and new ones. It will help to catch criticals in your product.

Title: Real-world testing
Description: It is relatively good idea to just put your product online and acquire some users to simply use it. If you are ready to rapidly fix all appearing problems.

Title: Cascade testing with user groups
Description: Full-scale testing with several stages, each bigger. You have prepared and made it all

Title: Website building
Description: You definitely need a website. Anything else? Probaply, not.

Title: Social media setup
Description: Who needs a website when you can make it all with a proper social media account?

Title: Website and Social Media
Description: It is often easier to gather audience via social media, but they should be landed somewhere.

Title: Full marketing commitment
Description: Social media, website, community hub, press releases, and contacts with influencers. You should have it all to succeed.

Title: Single server
Description: Simple backand will be more then enough. So why bother and spend additional money on an ifrastructure? What could possibly go wrong?

Title: Cloud infrastructure
Description: Why should we bother to make our own server if we can use a cloud? It is a little bit more expensive, but definitely much more convenient.

Title: Multiple servers
Description: We know how to make it on our own with all the redundancy we need to provide a consistent service to our clients.

Title: DevOPS team with an infrastructure
Description: Infrastructure needs to be carfully planned and maintained. So we need to hire a DevOPS team to help use make this project.

Title: Self application
Description: Just prepare all the documents and send it according to instructions on a DPG website.

Title: Contact DPG office to assist
Description: We can make it with the DPG office, if they are able to help.

Title: Address SDG relevance only
Description: You have checked if your product is SDG relevant or not. If it is - so why bother? It will work anyway.

Title: DPG indicator checklist
Description: You have your checklist, so you go thugh all 9 indicators and prepare properly your application.

Title: Release marketing campaign
Description: Your team is fully focused on a marketing campaign for the release. The technical side of things is not in focus.

Title: Release event
Description: Just throw a release event to attract an audience. They will watch the stream and then they will use your product.

Title: Some release preparations
Description: You clearly have not enough time to make it all, but you can address the majore issues and prepare the campaign on a decent level.

Title: Full scale release preparations
Description: Your team is working on the release, giving attention to everything. It will take time. But since you have one, you can afford it.

Title: Essential support only
Description: We don't have enough resources for the full scale support, so we will do only bare essentials.

Title: Phone and email customer support
Description: We will conduct a customer support via both phone and email.

Title: Support with LiveOPS
Description: We will not only make a support up and running, but also establish regular events and activities for our clients (LiveOPS).

Title: Outsourced support
Description: We no need our team to make a customer support. Let's hire an outsource company to make it for us!

Title: Limited water research
Description: Quick web search about basic water consumption statistics and common conservation tips. Focus on easily accessible data without deep scientific analysis.

Title: Customer-focused water research
Description: Conduct surveys and interviews with households to understand their water usage habits
column5: and willingness to change behaviors. Identify pain points in current water tracking methods.

Title: Technical water research
Description: Study hydrological databases
column5: and existing water tracking technologies. Research APIs for water data integration.

Title: Comprehensive water research
Description: Partner with hydrologists and environmental scientists to conduct in-depth research on regional water scarcity
column5: and behavioral science behind water conservation.

Title: Essential water calculator prototype
Description: Build a basic calculator that estimates water usage for common activities (shower
column5: cooking). Ugly interface but functional calculations.

Title: Service prototype for water audits
Description: Create a landing page where users can request manual water audits. Your team will conduct personalized water usage analysis for each early client.

Title: Technical water data prototype
Description: Develop a robust backend that integrates with water utility APIs and product water footprint databases. Focus on data accuracy over user experience.

Title: Product MVP for water tracking
Description: Build a complete mobile app with beautiful design
column6: and community features for selected beta users.

Title: Water conservation mission
Description: Define clear mission: "Empower everyone to understand and reduce their water footprint for a sustainable water future."

Title: Values and water strategy
Description: Establish core values (transparency
column5: accessibility) and develop strategy for reaching different user segments (households

Title: Values and water education mission
Description: Combine values of water justice with educational mission to raise awareness about global and local water issues.

Title: Complete water conservation framework
Description: Develop comprehensive framework including mission
column6: and measurable impact goals for water footprint reduction.

Title: Internal water usage testing
Description: Your team uses the app to track personal water consumption for one month. Identify basic usability issues and calculation errors.

Title: Focus group water testing
Description: Recruit 50 households from different water districts (varying water scarcity levels) to test the app for two weeks and provide detailed feedback.

Title: Real-world water tracking beta
Description: Release public beta version during drought season. Allow early adopters to use the app while you rapidly fix issues based on real usage data.

Title: Cascade water testing
Description: Multi-stage testing starting with water-conscious families

Title: Water education website
Description: Create informational website explaining water footprint concepts

Title: Social media water campaign
Description: Build presence on platforms popular with eco-conscious users. Share water saving tips

Title: Combined digital water platform
Description: Develop both website and social media presence
column4: using website for detailed information and social media for engagement and community building.

Title: Full water conservation campaign
Description: Partner with water utilities
column7: and community events around water conservation.

Title: Single server setup
Description: Basic server to handle initial user load. Cost-effective but risks downtime during peak usage or data-intensive calculations.

Title: Cloud infrastructure for water data
Description: Use cloud services that specialize in environmental data. More expensive but scalable and reliable for water calculation processing.

Title: Multiple regional servers
Description: Deploy servers in different geographic regions to handle local water data efficiently and provide faster response times for regional water calculations.

Title: DevOps team for water systems
Description: Hire specialized team to manage water data infrastructure
column4: ensure data security for sensitive water usage information

Title: Self DPG water application
Description: Independently prepare and submit application demonstrating how your app contributes to SDG 6 (Clean Water and Sanitation).

Title: DPG office consultation for water app
Description: Work with DPG advisors who specialize in water-related digital goods to strengthen your application and ensure proper SDG 6 alignment.

Title: Basic SDG 6 relevance check
Description: Verify that your app addresses clean water and sanitation issues
column4: but don't pursue full DPG certification yet.

Title: Complete DPG water checklist
Description: Systematically address all 9 DPG indicators specifically for water conservation impact

Title: World Water Day campaign
Description: Time your launch with World Water Day (March 22). Run intensive marketing campaign highlighting global water issues and your app's solutions.

Title: Water conservation event launch
Description: Host virtual or physical event featuring water experts
column5: and early users sharing their water saving success stories.

Title: Minimum viable launch
Description: Release core features for water tracking with basic educational content. Plan to add advanced features based on user feedback.

Title: Comprehensive water platform launch
Description: Launch with complete feature set including advanced analytics
column6: and integration with smart water devices.

Title: Essential water support
Description: Provide basic FAQ about water calculations and common conservation questions. Minimal investment in support resources.

Title: Full water conservation support
Description: Offer phone
column5: and chat support for technical issues and water conservation advice. Train support team on hydrological basics.

Title: LiveOps water challenges
Description: Run monthly water saving challenges
column4: host live Q&A sessions with water experts

Title: Outsourced water expertise
Description: Partner with environmental organizations to provide expert water conservation advice through your app's support system.
